intro.para: Consider a system of n linear equations in n unknowns whose coefficient matrix is invertible. We know then that this system of linear has exactly one solution. Here we use determinants to build a formula which computes this unique solution.

section.body.para: A nice application of Cramer’s rule is the following theorem. It provides a formula for computing the inverse of an invertible matrix.
A special case of the formula for the inverse of a matrix is the following simple formula for the inverse of an invertible (2,2)-matrix.
